verses.verse: Now will I sing<WH7891> to my wellbeloved<WH3039> a song<WH7892> of my beloved<WH1730> touching his vineyard<WH3754>. My wellbeloved<WH3039> hath a vineyard<WH3754> in a very fruitful<WH1121> <WH8081> hill<WH7161>: a very: Heb. the horn of the son of oil

And he fenced<WH5823> it, and gathered out the stones<WH5619> thereof, and planted<WH5193> it with the choicest vine<WH8321>, and built<WH1129> a tower<WH4026> in the midst<WH8432> of it, and also made<WH2672> a winepress<WH3342> therein: and he looked<WH6960> that it should bring forth<WH6213> grapes<WH6025>, and it brought forth<WH6213> wild grapes<WH891>. fenced: or, made a wall about made: Heb. hewed
And now, O inhabitants<WH3427> of Jerusalem<WH3389>, and men<WH376> of Judah<WH3063>, judge<WH8199>, I pray you, betwixt me and my vineyard<WH3754>.

What could have been done<WH6213> more to my vineyard<WH3754>, that I have not done<WH6213> in it? wherefore<WH4069>, when I looked<WH6960> that it should bring forth<WH6213> grapes<WH6025>, brought it forth<WH6213> wild grapes<WH891>?

And now go to; I will tell<WH3045> you what I will do<WH6213> to my vineyard<WH3754>: I will take away<WH5493> the hedge<WH4881> thereof, and it shall be eaten up<WH1197>; and break down<WH6555> the wall<WH1447> thereof, and it shall be trodden down<WH4823>: trodden: Heb. for a treading

And I will lay<WH7896> it waste<WH1326>: it shall not be pruned<WH2168>, nor digged<WH5737>; but there shall come up<WH5927> briers<WH8068> and thorns<WH7898>: I will also command<WH6680> the clouds<WH5645> that they rain<WH4305> no rain<WH4306> upon it.

For the vineyard<WH3754> of the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> is the house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478>, and the men<WH376> of Judah<WH3063> his pleasant<WH8191> plant<WH5194>: and he looked<WH6960> for judgment<WH4941>, but behold oppression<WH4939>; for righteousness<WH6666>, but behold a cry<WH6818>. his: Heb. plant of his pleasures oppression: Heb. a scab

Woe<WH1945> unto them that join<WH5060> house<WH1004> to house<WH1004>, that lay<WH7126> field<WH7704> to field<WH7704>, till there be no<WH657> place<WH4725>, that they may be placed<WH3427> alone in the midst<WH7130> of the earth<WH776>! they: Heb. ye

In mine ears<WH241> said the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>, Of a truth<WH3808> many<WH7227> houses<WH1004> shall be desolate<WH8047>, even great<WH1419> and fair<WH2896>, without inhabitant<WH3427>. In: or, This is in mine ears, saith the LORD, etc Of a: Heb. If not, etc
Yea<WH3588>, ten<WH6235> acres<WH6776> of vineyard<WH3754> shall yield<WH6213> one<WH259> bath<WH1324>, and the seed<WH2233> of an homer<WH2563> shall yield<WH6213> an ephah<WH374>.

Woe<WH1945> unto them that rise up early<WH7925> in the morning<WH1242>, that they may follow<WH7291> strong drink<WH7941>; that continue<WH309> until night<WH5399>, till wine<WH3196> inflame<WH1814> them! inflame: of, pursue

And the harp<WH3658>, and the viol<WH5035>, the tabret<WH8596>, and pipe<WH2485>, and wine<WH3196>, are in their feasts<WH4960>: but they regard<WH5027> not the work<WH6467> of the LORD<WH3068>, neither consider<WH7200> the operation<WH4639> of his hands<WH3027>.

Therefore my people<WH5971> are gone into captivity<WH1540>, because they have no knowledge<WH1847>: and their honourable<WH3519> men<WH4962> are famished<WH7458>, and their multitude<WH1995> dried up<WH6704> with thirst<WH6772>. honourable: Heb. glory are men of famine

Therefore hell<WH7585> hath enlarged<WH7337> herself<WH5315>, and opened<WH6473> her mouth<WH6310> without measure<WH2706>: and their glory<WH1926>, and their multitude<WH1995>, and their pomp<WH7588>, and he that rejoiceth<WH5938>, shall descend<WH3381> into it.
And the mean man<WH120> shall be brought down<WH7817>, and the mighty man<WH376> shall be humbled<WH8213>, and the eyes<WH5869> of the lofty<WH1364> shall be humbled<WH8213>:

But the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> shall be exalted<WH1361> in judgment<WH4941>, and God<WH410> that is holy<WH6918> shall be sanctified<WH6942> in righteousness<WH6666>. God: or, the holy God: Heb. the God the holy
Then shall the lambs<WH3532> feed<WH7462> after their manner<WH1699>, and the waste places<WH2723> of the fat ones<WH4220> shall strangers<WH1481> eat<WH398>.
Woe<WH1945> unto them that draw<WH4900> iniquity<WH5771> with cords<WH2256> of vanity<WH7723>, and sin<WH2403> as it were with a cart<WH5699> rope<WH5688>:

That say<WH559>, Let him make speed<WH4116>, and hasten<WH2363> his work<WH4639>, that we may see<WH7200> it: and let the counsel<WH6098> of the Holy One<WH6918> of Israel<WH3478> draw nigh<WH7126> and come<WH935>, that we may know<WH3045> it!

Woe<WH1945> unto them that call<WH559> evil<WH7451> good<WH2896>, and good<WH2896> evil<WH7451>; that put<WH7760> darkness<WH2822> for light<WH216>, and light<WH216> for darkness<WH2822>; that put<WH7760> bitter<WH4751> for sweet<WH4966>, and sweet<WH4966> for bitter<WH4751>! call: Heb. say concerning evil, It is good, etc
Woe<WH1945> unto them that are wise<WH2450> in their own eyes<WH5869>, and prudent<WH995> in their own sight<WH6440>! in their own sight: Heb. before their face
Woe<WH1945> unto them that are mighty<WH1368> to drink<WH8354> wine<WH3196>, and men<WH582> of strength<WH2428> to mingle<WH4537> strong drink<WH7941>:
Which justify<WH6663> the wicked<WH7563> for<WH6118> reward<WH7810>, and take away<WH5493> the righteousness<WH6666> of the righteous<WH6662> from him!

Therefore as the fire<WH784> devoureth<WH398> the stubble<WH7179>, and the flame<WH3956> <WH3852> consumeth<WH7503> the chaff<WH2842>, so their root<WH8328> shall be as rottenness<WH4716>, and their blossom<WH6525> shall go up<WH5927> as dust<WH80>: because they have cast away<WH3988> the law<WH8451> of the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>, and despised<WH5006> the word<WH565> of the Holy One<WH6918> of Israel<WH3478>. fire: Heb. tongue of fire

Therefore is the anger<WH639> of the LORD<WH3068> kindled<WH2734> against his people<WH5971>, and he hath stretched forth<WH5186> his hand<WH3027> against them, and hath smitten<WH5221> them: and the hills<WH2022> did tremble<WH7264>, and their carcases<WH5038> were torn<WH5478> in the midst<WH7130> of the streets<WH2351>. For all this his anger<WH639> is not turned away<WH7725>, but his hand<WH3027> is stretched out<WH5186> still. torn: or, as dung

And he will lift up<WH5375> an ensign<WH5251> to the nations<WH1471> from far<WH7350>, and will hiss<WH8319> unto them from the end<WH7097> of the earth<WH776>: and, behold, they shall come<WH935> with speed<WH4120> swiftly<WH7031>:

None shall be weary<WH5889> nor stumble<WH3782> among them; none shall slumber<WH5123> nor sleep<WH3462>; neither shall the girdle<WH232> of their loins<WH2504> be loosed<WH6605>, nor the latchet<WH8288> of their shoes<WH5275> be broken<WH5423>:

Whose arrows<WH2671> are sharp<WH8150>, and all their bows<WH7198> bent<WH1869>, their horses'<WH5483> hoofs<WH6541> shall be counted<WH2803> like flint<WH6862>, and their wheels<WH1534> like a whirlwind<WH5492>:

Their roaring<WH7581> shall be like a lion<WH3833>, they shall roar<WH7580> <WH7580> like young lions<WH3715>: yea, they shall roar<WH5098>, and lay hold<WH270> of the prey<WH2964>, and shall carry it away safe<WH6403>, and none shall deliver<WH5337> it.

And in that day<WH3117> they shall roar<WH5098> against them like the roaring<WH5100> of the sea<WH3220>: and if one look<WH5027> unto the land<WH776>, behold darkness<WH2822> and sorrow<WH6862>, and the light<WH216> is darkened<WH2821> in the heavens<WH6183> thereof. sorrow: or, distress and the light: or, when it is light, it shall be dark in the destructions thereof
